items.text: The habit of savings is itself an education, it fosters every virtue, teaches self-denial, cultivates the sense of order, trains to forethought and broadens the mind.
items.caption: Bees making honey.

items.text: A man who both spends and saves money is the happiest man, because he has both enjoyments.
items.caption: An African man feeling happy within.

items.text: You don't need a specific reason to start saving...because cash is the oxygen of independence.
items.caption: Deep blue sky with white clouds.

items.text: If you would be wealthy, think of saving as well as getting.
items.caption: Man counting coins.

items.text: The art is not so much in making money, but also in keeping it.
items.caption: Basketball goalpost.

items.text: Building wealth has little do with your income or investment returns and a lot do with your savings rate.
items.caption: Edge of a Skyscraper building.

items.text: By sowing, we reap liberty, a golden harvest.
items.caption: Coins in a cup with a seed germinating.
